rtp_h.intro_audio_Txt: These RTP settings concern the IP addresses and port numbers to use for audio streams.
rtp_h.intro_start_Txt: These RTP settings concern the IP addresses and port numbers to use for video
rtp_h.rtp_audio_ports2_Txt: The RTP Port range defines the range of ports from which the audio
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_ports2_Txt: The RTP Port range defines the range of ports from which the video
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt1: ports are automatically selected. This feature is useful if the Axis product is connected to a NAT router with manually configured port mapping.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt2: Limit the range of ports permitted for RTP unicast/multicast by entering the Start port and End port in the provided fields.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt4: The NAT router has been manually configured to map:
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt5: ports 50000-50099 to the IP address of product 1
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt6: ports 50100-50199 to the IP address of product 2
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_end_Txt7: Set the port range in product 1 to 50000-50099 and in product 2 to 50100-50199.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_ports2_note_audio_video_Txt1: Note: Audio and video streams each require one RTP session, and each RTP session requires 2 ports. This means that a total of 4 ports must be available for each connecting unicast client requesting both audio and video (e.g. 2 clients will need 8 ports). The multicast session only ever requires a total of 4 ports, however many clients connect to it.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_ports2_note_audio_video_Txt2: If audio is disabled, then each unicast session will only need 2 ports for each client, and the multicast session will need a total of 2 ports for all clients.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_ports2_note_Txt1: Note: Each RTP session needs 2 ports, which means 2 ports for each unicast session, or 2 ports for the multicast session in total.
rtp_h.rtp_mpeg4_ports2_note_Txt2: Note: Each RTP session needs 2 ports, which means 2 ports for each unicast session, or 2 ports for the multicast session in total.
rtp_h.addresses_general_Txt: - Only IP addresses within certain ranges can be used for multicasting. The product has been pre-configured with addresses from these ranges, and does not normally need to be reconfigured. If an address does need to be changed, contact your network administrator.
rtp_h.ports_audio_Txt1: The audio ports entered here must be even values:
rtp_h.ports_audio_Txt2: Set the audio port to '0' for a random port number
rtp_h.ports_audio_Txt3: Set the audio port to a value between 1024-65534
rtp_h.ports_videoaudio_Txt1: The video/audio ports entered here must be even values:
rtp_h.ports_videoaudio_Txt2: Set the video/audio port to '0' for a random port number
rtp_h.ports_videoaudio_Txt3: Set the video/audio port to a value between 1024-65534
rtp_h.ports_Txt: The video port entered here must be an even value. Setting the port to 0 means a random (even) port number will be used.
rtp_h.notes_Txt1: Note 1: Multicast addresses are allocated according to these IANA policies.
rtp_h.notes_Txt2: Note 2: Viewers do not need to know
rtp_h.notes_audio_Txt: these IP addresses or port numbers
rtp_h.notes_no_audio_Txt: the multicast address or video port number
rtp_h.notes_end_Txt: , but only the main IP address or host name otherwise used for accessing the product.
rtp_h.note3notes_Txt: Note 3: Port 1026 cannot be used, since it is already being used internally.
rtp_h.tTL_Txt: Time To Live - This setting tells the network routers when to discard an IP data packet if it fails to be delivered. The value is measured in the number of network routers that can be passed before it arrives at its destination.
rtp_h.aM_video_Txt: Always Multicast Video - Select this option and the desired stream profile from the drop-down list and click Save to start a multicast video stream without RTSP control.
rtp_h.aM_audio_Txt: Always Multicast Audio - Select this option and click Save to start a multicast audio stream without RTSP control.
rtp_h.enDisMulticast_Txt: Note: If stream profile is changed while Always Multicast Video is selected, in order for changes to take effect immediately, this option should be disabled and enabled again. Otherwise the change will take effect only after camera's restart.
